questions.title: For whom are you filling in this survey?
description: Why are we asking this?
COVID-19 and flu are thought to spread very effectively at home, so it's important to know which Flusurvey (or Influweb or Influensakoll or…) participants live in the same household.
How should I answer it?
A household member is defined as a someone (not necessarily related) who lives at the same address as you and who shares cooking facilities and a living room, sitting room or dining area
rules: Question to be asked when adding another participant. For each additional person that a person registered this question should be asked. If a person just registers and enters data for himself, then this question should not be asked.

questions.title: What is your gender?
description: Why are we asking this?
To find out  whether the chance of getting COVID-19 or flu are different between men and women.

questions.title: What is your date of birth (month and year)?
description: Why are we asking this?
The chance of getting COVID-19 and flu and the risk of more serious complications vary by age.

questions.title: What is the first part of your home postcode (the part before the space)?
questions.comment: Code representing the location of the participant, at the level the platform want to register it

questions.title: What is your main activity?
description: Why are we asking this?

To check how representative our sample is compared to the population as a whole, and to find out whether the chance of getting COVID-19 or flu are different for people in different types of occupation.
How should I answer it?
Please tick the box that most closely resembles your main occupation. For pre-school children who don’t go to daycare tick the “other” box.

questions.title: What is the first part of your school/college/workplace postcode?
rules: Shown If  [Yes, Paid employment full time], or [Yes, paid employment part time] to $Q4
If '0', then ask for $Q4b_0_open, as a extra field
description: Why are we asking this?
To find out roughly how far you travel on a regular basis.
How should I answer it?
Please choose the first part of the post-code (the part before the space).

questions.title: Which of the following descriptions most closely matches with your main occupation?

option_1.text: Professional (e.g. manager, doctor, teacher, nurse, engineer)

option_2.text: Office work (e.g. admin, finance assistant, receptionist etc)

option_3.text: Retail, sales, catering and hospitality and leisure (e.g. shop assistant, waiter, bar-staff, gym instructor etc)

option_4.text: Skilled manual worker (e.g. mechanic, electrician, technician)

rules: If [Yes, Paid employment full time], or [Yes, paid employment part time] to $Q4
Trigger free text if [other] checked, allow the users to write in their occupation
description: Why are we asking this?

To check how representative our sample is compared to the population as a whole and to find out whether the chance of getting COVID-19 or flu are different for people in different types of occupation.
How should I answer it?
Please tick the box that most closely resembles your main occupation.

questions.title: What is the highest level of formal education/qualification that you have?

option_3.text: A-levels or equivalent (e.g. Higher, NVQ Level3, BTEC)

option_5.comment: Higher Degree or equivalent (e.g. Masters Degree, PGCE, PhD, Medical Doctorate, Advanced Professional Award)

comment: This is the UK version. #option_2 is exams taken at the time of early school leaving (16  in the UK), #option_3 for late school leaving (18 in the UK). The others are for degrees, or higher qualifications, which should be fairly comparable across Europe.
The questions that you should ask at the options #option_2 and #option_3, are related to exams taken at early and late school leaving ages.
description: Why are we asking this?
To check how representative our sample is compared to the population of the UK (Italy, Belgium, etc…. ) as a whole.
How should I answer it?
- Please choose the box that represents your HIGHEST level of educational achievement. The different options roughly equate to: No qualifications
- school-leaving exams at around 16 years of age
- school-leaving exams at around 18 years of age
- University degree, or equivalent professional qualification
- Higher degree or advanced professional qualification
If you are an adult who is currently undergoing part-time training (e.g. night-school)  then tick the box that represents your current highest level of education.

questions.title: Except people you meet on public transports, do you have contact with any of the following during the course of a typical day? (Select all options that apply, if any)

option_1.text: More than 10 children or teenagers over the course of the day

option_2.text: More than 10 people aged over 65 over the course of day

option_4.text: Groups of people (more than 10 individuals at any one time)

questions.title: INCLUDING YOU, how many people in each of the following age groups live in your household?

option_1.comment: matrix-like option, with drop down menu

option_2.comment: matrix-like option, with drop down menu

option_3.comment: matrix-like option, with drop down menu

option_4.comment: matrix-like option, with drop down menu

option_5.comment: matrix-like option, with drop down menu

comment: This should be a table with the 1st column being the age groups (as above), and the 2nd column being numbers, 0,1,2,3,4,5+. It should be PRE-FILLED with zeros.
Preferably to be pre-filled for multiple users of a single account, if they’re in the same household?
description: Why are we asking this?
Members of larger households, or those with children, may be more likely to catch COVID-19 or flu than others.
How should I answer it?
A household is defined as a group of people (not necessarily related) living at the same address who share cooking facilities and share a living room, sitting room or dining area.

questions.title: How many of the children in your household go to school or day-care?
comment: Ideally, this question would only be asked if they have children aged 0-4 – or if they’re aged 0-4 themselves, and the answer would be a drop-down menu with the right number of options.
Preferably, this be pre-filled for multiple users of a single account, if they’re in the same household
description: Why are we asking this?
Attending school or day-care may be a risk for acquiring COVID-19 or flu and similar illnesses. We would like to check this.
How should I answer it?
If your child attends regular school or day-care (even if this is just one day a week) then please answer yes to this. Attendance of clubs and activities does not count – even if regular.

questions.title: What is your main mean of transport?
description: Why are we asking this?
It has been suggested that using public transport may be a risk for COVID-19 or flu. We would like to check this.
How should I answer it?
Tick the option that best represents your most normal mode of transport.

questions.title: On a normal day, how much time do you spend on public transport? (Bus, train, tube etc.)
description: Why are we asking this?
It has been suggested that using public transport may be a risk for getting COVID-19 or flu. We would like to check this.
How should I answer it?
Think of a typical day. If you use several different forms of public transport each day, remember to include all journeys. Don’t include taxis or other forms of private transport.

questions.title: How often do you have common colds or flu-like diseases?
Did you receive a flu vaccine during the last autumn/winter season?
questions.comment: Note that the years will need to be changed each year.
description: Why are we asking this?
We would like to be able to work out how much protection the vaccine gives.
How should I answer it?
Report yes, if you received the vaccine this season, usually in the autumn. If you get vaccinated after filling in this questionnaire, please return to this and update your answer.

questions.title: Did you receive a flu vaccine this winter season?
comment: Note that the years will need to be changed each year.
description: Why are we asking this?
We would like to be able to work out how much protection the vaccine gives. We would also like to find out  if there is some protection from vaccines received in previous years.
How should I answer it?
Answer yes if you received the vaccine last year (during the autumn/winter of 2010-2011).

questions.title: When were you vaccinated against this flu season?
What were your reasons for getting a seasonal influenza vaccination this year?

option_1.text: I belong to a risk group (e.g, pregnant, over 65, underlying health condition, etc)

option_12.text: The COVID-19 context encouraged me to get influenza vaccination this year 12

option_2.text: Vaccination decreases my risk of getting the flu

option_3.text: Vaccination decreases the risk of spreading the flu to others

option_5.text: It was recommended in my workplace/school

option_6.text: The vaccine was readily available and vaccine administration was convenient

option_8.text: I don’t want to miss work/school

questions.title: What were your reasons for NOT getting a seasonal influenza vaccination this year?

option_1.text: I am planning to be vaccinated but haven’t been yet

option_2.text: I haven’t been offered the vaccine

option_3.text: I don’t belong to a risk group

option_4.text: It is better to build your own natural immunity against influenza

option_5.text: I doubt that the influenza vaccine is effective

option_16.text: Because of COVID-19 pandemic, I avoid seing doctors or going to the pharmacy

option_17.text: I am afraid that influenza vaccine would increase my risk of getting COVID-19

option_18.text: Other reason linked with COVID-19 (open field)

option_7.text: I don’t think I am likely to get the flu

option_8.text: I believe that influenza vaccine can cause influenza

option_9.text: I am worried that the vaccine is not safe or will cause illness or other adverse events

option_11.text: The vaccine is not readily available for me

option_12.text: The vaccine is not free of charge

option_14.text: Although my doctor recommended a vaccine, I did not get one

questions.title: Do you take regular medication for any of the following medical conditions?

option_4.text: Chronic lung disorder besides asthma e.g. COPD, emphysema, or other disorders that affect your breathing

option_7.text: An immunocompromising condition (e.g. splenectomy, organ transplant, acquired immune deficiency, cancer treatment)

description: Why are we asking this?
This question allows us to find out whether you have other medical conditions that may increase your risk of having more severe illness if you are infected with COVID-19 or flu.
How should I answer it?
Only answer “yes” if you take regular medication for your medical problem. If, for instance, you only occasionally take an asthma inhaler, then do not answer “yes” for asthma.

questions.title: Are you currently pregnant?

option_3.text: I don’t know/I would rather not answer

rules: Only asked of women between ages 15 and 50)
description: Why are we asking this?
Pregnancy can result in more severe illness if you are infected with COVID-19 or flu.
How should I answer it?
Answer yes if you are pregnant today.

questions.title: Which trimester of the pregnancy are you in?
description: Why are we asking this?
The stage of pregnancy might alter your risk of severe COVID-19 or flu if you are infected, although this is not very clear.
How should I answer it?
Which trimester are you in today?

questions.title: Do you smoke tobacco?

option_3.text: Yes, daily, fewer than 10 times a day

option_4.text: Yes, daily, 10 or more times a day

description: Why are we asking this?
Smoking might make you more likely to get a more severe dose of COVID-19 or flu. We would like to test this.
How should I answer it?
Please answer as accurately as possible. If you smoke other products (e.g. a pipe or cigars), then indicate roughly how many times a day.

questions.title: Do you have any of the following allergies that can cause respiratory symptoms? (select all options that apply)

option_3.text: Allergy against domestic animals or pets

option_4.text: Other allergies that cause respiratory symptoms (e.g. sneezing, runny eyes)

option_5.text: I do not have an allergy that causes respiratory symptoms

description: Why are we asking this?
Some allergic reactions can have similar symptoms to respiratory infection.
How should I answer it?
Tick all the options that apply. We are only interested in those allergies that cause respiratory symptoms (i.e. sneezing, runny nose, runny eyes).
rules: Item #option_5 is exclusive with others to ensure consistency

questions.title: Do you follow a special diet? (Select all options that apply)
rules: Item #option_1 is exclusive with others to ensure consistency

questions.title: Do you have pets at home? (Select all options that apply)

option_5.text: Yes, one or more other animals

questions.title: Where did you first hear about the platform?

option_2.text: In the newspaper or in a magazine

option_3.text: Via an internet site (search engine or link)

questions.title: Are you taking or do you plan to take this winter homeopathic medicine in order to prevent COVID-19?
